rows.title: How to remove items from a list while iterating?
What does a "Cannot find symbol" or "Cannot resolve symbol" error mean?
How do I write a correct micro-benchmark in Java?
How to reshape data from long to wide format
How to extract and access data from JSON with PHP?

73: <p>Make sure you somehow use results which are computed in benchmarked code. Otherwise your code can be optimized away.</p>

<p><a href="http://opt.sourceforge.net/" rel="noreferrer">http://opt.sourceforge.net/</a> Java Micro Benchmark - control tasks required to determine the comparative performance characteristics of the computer system on different platforms. Can be used to guide optimization decisions and to compare different Java implementations.</p>
74:
<p>If you're getting this error in the build somewhere else, while your IDE says everything is perfectly fine, then check that you are using the same Java versions in both places.</p>

<p>For example, Java 7 and Java 8 have different APIs, so calling a non-existent API in an older Java version would cause this error.</p>

<p>you compiled your code using maven compile and then used maven test to run it worked fine. Now if you changed something in your code and then without compiling you are running it, you will get this error.</p>

<p>Solution: Again compile it and then run test. For me it worked this way.</p>

<p>I had the same problem on compiling my project, I checked my java compiler version, it used to be working on java 1.8 but accidentally set to java 17, I changed it back to version 1.8 and my issue resolved.</p>

<p><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/bM7uY.png" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.stack.imgur.com/bM7uY.png" alt="enter image description here"></a></p>
<p>I solved this error like this... The craziness of android. I had the package name as Adapter and the I refactor the name to adapter with an "a" instead of "A" and solved the error.</p>
75:
<p>You need to take a copy of the list and iterate over it first, or the iteration will fail with what may be unexpected results.</p>

<p>For example (depends on what type of list):</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> tup <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> somelist[:]:
    etc....
</code></pre>

<p>An example:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>somelist = <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-number">10</span>)
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> x <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> somelist:
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    somelist.remove(x)
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>somelist
[<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">3</span>, <span class="hljs-number">5</span>, <span class="hljs-number">7</span>, <span class="hljs-number">9</span>]

<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>somelist = <span class="hljs-built_in">range</span>(<span class="hljs-number">10</span>)
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span><span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> x <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> somelist[:]:
<span class="hljs-meta">... </span>    somelist.remove(x)
<span class="hljs-meta">&gt;&gt;&gt; </span>somelist
[]
</code></pre>

<p>You might want to use <code>filter()</code> available as the built-in.</p>

<p>For more details <a href="http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#filter" rel="nofollow noreferrer">check here</a></p>
